headline: Best Bread Machine Bread
description: This bread machine recipe is easy-to-follow to the point of being foolproof, delivering soft bread with a flaky crust that everyone will love!

video.description: See how to make the perfect loaf of bread in your bread machine.
video.name: Bread Machine Bread

name: Best Bread Machine Bread
recipeIngredient: 1 cup warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)

recipeInstructions.text: Place water, sugar, and yeast in the pan of the bread machine. Let yeast dissolve and foam for 10 minutes. Add oil, flour, and salt to the yeast. Select Basic or White Bread setting, and press Start.
Remove loaf from the machine after the cycle is done; cool in the pan for 5 minutes before turning it out onto a rack to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: Great texture. It's a little too sweet for sandwich bread. Came out a little doughy so I might adjust backing times.
I did exactly as directed, I made 6 rolls and 1 loaf of bread. They rose perfectly, Best looking bread I ever made BUT when I brushed the tops with egg for Sesame seeds they collapsed? What happened?

I made it with 1/3 whole wheat and 2/3 white flour and added extra rosemary in it . It turned out beautifully. Unfortunately it was too little for us so next time I will try to do double dose. Very happy with this recipeüëè
I used the Fleischmann‚Äôs active yeast and tried the 2lb setting in my bread machine . The bread turned out great !
love it!
Good but popped the lid off my machine lol! Going to put less yeast in next time
Easy awesome recipe.
I‚Äôm making it right now, but I don‚Äôt know what size. I put 2.5 pounds but it looks so small. Probably should of put 2 pound. I‚Äôll make a new rating if this works out.
I made this Bread just as it was written. We loved it, would'nt change a thing. I give it 5 stars.
It was so soft and yummy! This has been the second loaf I have made and it was very simple

I have made this recipe several times now. I think I have figured out the tweaks. 8 oz is not enough water. 8.4oz seems to be about right (I use a scale). I use 2.5 cups bread flour and .5 cups all-purpose flour. This comes out softer. I do not like the cube shape my bread machine bakes, so I mix the dough in the bread machine, but finish in bread pan in the oven 350¬∞ for ~30 minutes. I have let it rise in the bread machine and let it rise in a low temp oven. Results are about the same.

Loved this loaf. I followed other evaluators suggestion by substituting melted butter for oil. I saw that canola oil did not work well either. It was GREAT! no need to butter the bread and I am delighted.

Excellent recipe when I use Platinum Yeast with other ingredients but, learned quickly not to use a Rapid Yeast as it has a very strong yeast flavor. We didn't care for it that way so, we stick with the Platinum brand now.
Flavor could use a boost. I'm going to try again just to make sure I didn't miss anything since reviews are pretty good.

Best bread I‚Äôve ever made It‚Äôs texture is perfect and taste delicious. I‚Äôve been using a recipe that is in the book that came with the bread machine and it‚Äôs ok but this one is so much better. I like using butter instead of oil and it came out perfect. I use the dough setting and than bake in oven I will be using this recipe
Came out great! I was unsure about the amount of yeast, so I was worried it would not be right. But it is delicious! It even came right out of the pan!

3000th review woooo! So glad I found your recipe, only my 3rd attempt making bread at all, and the first two were dreadful, but this one is so soft and airy with a nice crust, didn't change anything in the recipe and it's wonderful. Thanks.
If, like me, you have a bread machine with an awkwardly shaped bread pan and would prefer to bake it in an oven using a 9x5 loaf pan, 35 minutes at 350 came out perfect.

I usually make bread from scratch and received a bread machine as a gift. I‚Äôve tried this recipe twice and my bread has turned out great. I usually have to make some adjustments for high altitude but I didn‚Äôt with this recipe. It‚Äôs super simple. I did use butter instead of oil.

The best white bread I ever made or tasted. Amazing! I often buy bread from the bakeries famous for artisan bread but this one came out better than any if those. I followed the recipe and used olive oil.
I made and I loved it. I substituted the vegetable oil for canola oil and it came out wonderful. Love it making another loaf today.
Followed the recipe exactly, the dough came up over the bread tin and ran down inside the machine and burnt, waste of ingredients.
Really helped me out as a single dad with zero baking skills and wanting to save some money by making our own bread. Thank you
I failed making bread 3 times! Until I found your recipe. Thank you!! Please tell me you have more bread recipes!!

Every thing I have read and done in the past say done let the yeast hit the water. But with such great reviews I followed this‚Ä¶. Big mistake!! I measured everything and even temped the water. What a bloody waste!
Yes I have used the express bake and it comes out perfectly- this recipe beats all the rest and it is vegan which is great!

After 3 tries with other recipes in a new bread machine that I bought, this one was a winner. Delicious, very soft loaf, both the inside crumb and the crust. I opted for the one pound size on my machine.
I've made this twice so far, with one change, I used 1/4 cup unsalted butter and it turned out great. My family has agreed this is a great sandwich bread.
I made it. The inside was super soft. The only problem I had was the outer part was hard. Is it supposed to be like that?
We really like this recipe. It comes out soft and has a really good flavor! It's not super light & fluffy but not real dense & heavy like so many recipes are.

It was pretty good; certainly 100% better than the recipe that came with my machine. The machine I have makes 1 lb loaves. I tried playing with the ingredients to make a smaller loaf, but could use some guidance on that.

First time making bread in the bread machine I picked up at a local auction. The 1st loaf I made I used the recipe that was in the manual that came with the machine. The loaf turned out awful. Tried loaf #2 following another recipe I found online. Again it was awful. Couldn't decide if it was the machine and so I made a 3rd loaf using this recipe. It came out perfect! It came out actually as I was hoping. So happy it turned out that the bread machine worked just like it was supposed to. I have made several more loafs and they have also been perfect. With the cost of bread these days it has made sense to make my own. Thanks for such a fantastic recipe!!
It is very simple, very basic and very good... just what I need.
This bread turned out perfect! I used Instant yeast from an Amish market. First loaf that hasn‚Äôt been as dense as soda bread! I used La Roux Butter EVOO.

I've made this twice now with the only adjustments to the recipe being I used 1.5 teaspoons of salt, & I used plain dry active yeast, because that's all I had. The first time I made it, I used the regular Bake setting on my machine, which includes 30 minutes of rest time before kneading. Although the inside of the loaf was light & fluffy, the crust was super thick. After reading through the comments & learning about the difference between dry active yeast & instant/bread machine yeast, the second time I used the Rapid Bake setting on my machine, which doesn't have a rest time before kneading, & the loaf was wonderful! A perfect crust that was golden but not crunchy, & a light, fluffy middle. This toasts up so much better than store bought bread, I'll probably be baking two loaves a week. Next time I'm going to add onion powder & caramelized onions to the mix like another reviewer suggested. Oh my.

The recipe seems like a good starting point, but I've found that I needed to reduce the amount of yeast to 1-1/2 ts to make it work. If I go with the amount stated the loaf rises and then falls. It might be due to my method of flour measurement. Previously I was using a 1 cup measure and just scooping the flour out of the bag, but that made the loaf way too dense. Now I put 3 cups of flour into a bowl aerate it with a fork and spoon it into the measuring cup. Not sure if that's the right way but it seems to work reasonably well.
This bread turned out awesome, love it!!!
It works well, just what I needed, a basic recipe.

I decided to try and make this with gluten free flour bad idea. Made it a second time with bread flour which was yummy. Making this a third time with 1/3 gluten free flour, and increased the water to 1 and 1/4 cups of water at 125¬∞ degrees and added 1 tsp of baking powder. So far it looks good. Gluten still but reduced gluten for those of that are gluten sensitive.
You have created a monster. This turned out beautifully. I have to say it came out even bigger than my 2 lb. Setting and l only used the one lb. Delicious. Can‚Äôt add photos as it is 1/2 gone üòç

This is my go to no fuss bread machine recipe! Do not follow machine ‚Äòrecipe booklet‚Äô - unless you love being disappointed & wasting a ton of time. Bread is perfect for everything from sandwiches to french toast!
Yeah, Make this. This was incredibly simple and insanely good!!!!

First time using my bread machine and used this recipe. Turned out amazing! Bread rose a little too high but that's my fault, I put an entire package of yeast (8g) and after reading the manual of my machine it says the max amount of yeast used in the machine is 6g.

This simple recipe turned out really well. I have been following the same recipe for years and have always used canola oil as with this but I didn't find any problem. Fluffy, light. The only thing I didn't do, but it didn't make a difference, was let the yeast froth in the water for 10 minutes (I overlooked this part?) However, the results were very good. I wasn't too sure how it would turn out with out the powdered milk component and the bread improver, but it seems that these ingredients made little difference in this recipe.
Super easy to make, and üòã delicious

This recipe was excellent. I took one reviewer's advice and increased the salt to 1 1/2 teaspoons of salt and the loaf rose perfectly and never fell. It isn't a dense bread, it is so light and airy! I used my candy thermometer to make sure the water temp was 110 degrees. I also selected light crust because that's my preference. Absolutely perfect.
Easy to make and came out very good
I made this the 1st time the way instructed. This is a basic bread recipe. The 2nd time I used 3 tbs of butter (instead of oil) and 3 tbs of sugar.
Followed recipe exactly and this is great bread. Making again except youngest step-son wants to do this one. Thanks.
It works, I just added a bit more of water and other spices like oregano and albahaca

Delicious flavor and texture is great. Cooked on light setting. The thing I‚Äôm not crazy about is the way it looks on top like. I think this is probably my bread machine not the recipe. Will make again. My bread machine is a Hamilton Beach
I added one more tbsp of sugar and half teaspoon salt. It turned out to be the best I ever made.

This was absolutely not only easy but very delicious!!! I will be making this every week! I am going to try and freeze it and see how well it will do after thawing. If it works I‚Äôll be making up a bunch to freeze for a quick loaf this summer!
Perfect bread! i added garlic, 2 tsp of yeast, delicious
Excellent, light, delicious. 3 year old daughter demanded some immediately. First time followed recipe exactly, now trying all-purpose flour and olive oil.

I just recently bought a new thrift shop bread machine. I had stopped making bread because of holes forming in the bread. I believe due to how this recipe warms the yeast first, I had beautifully formed bread for the first time. And it tastes great!
Beast bread recipe I have ever used. Fantastic consistency and great taste, along with excellent slice ability .
The bread turned out perfect! I did use avocado oil!

I‚Äôve made this recipe a dozen times, literally, in the last four days. That‚Äôs how much my family loves this simple recipe üî•‚ù§Ô∏è Super delicious for sandwiches, cinnamon toast, French toast, or whatever your heart desires ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
I made it in my very old Salton bread maker, I had to convert the yeast to grams it worked out to be about 7g bat I think I wood ad jest a bit more next time, this one is going to the recipe book

I have never baked bread in my whole life, let alone use a bread machine but this is a perfect first recipe. I replaced the oil with olive oil, used slightly more salt as others advised, and used active dry yeast, but other than that this recipe needed nothing. I cooked it on 1lb setting on my machine with light crust and it turned out perfect first try! It is a somewhat plain tasting bread but it's white bread so no complaints.

Used the exact listed ingredients, with olive oil. The last 1/2 cup I used regular white flour. It came out perfectly. I didn't love the flavor - maybe the taste of the oil, and I found it a bit sweet, but it turned out well.
New to the bread making process purchased a bread maker a day ago but having fun learning about it this is great I used coconut oil and it turned out great

i made this bread recipe doing exactly as the directions indicated..and not adding or taking anything away..It turned out beautifully and i am going to be making this again.I've tried many recipes before..but this was the BEST!!!
I made this recipe and it turned out awful. I was left with bread crumbs!
Was pretty good! Have made it twice so must‚Äôve liked it! Very easy to make

Run this recipe twice. One as written and another as an alternate adding 2/3c dried cranberries, 2 Tbs honey, 1 tsp pumpkin pie spice (would double next time), and about 1/2c of pecans. Both were DELICIOUS!
I made this and followed the recipe exactly. Delicious, soft white bread! This will be my new "go to" recipe for my bread machine.

After 7 other recipes, THIS is the best. For white bread, I added the 1/2 t. salt recommended in the comments, taste was excellent. Next, I followed Crystal S. recipe for wheat and it was the best I have ever made. The texture, rise, crust and taste was better than store-bought. The wheat recipe makes a 2 lb loaf so I am going to divide it into two 1 lb loaves next time. I like to cook my bread in the oven. After the bread machine dough setting completes (mine takes 90 minutes), gently remove dough from the pan to lightly floured area. Let it rest for 5 minutes. Gently shape into loaf and place in greased pan, turning once to grease the top and with the seam side down. Then "proof" it or let it rise the second time in an oven (heated to 200 but then turned off). Place the bread pan on top of a wet dish towel in middle rack with room to rise to double (mine took 25 minutes). The low heat and humidity are perfect. Remove pan and dish towel. Heat oven to 400 with an empty roasting pan on the bottom rack. When Temp is ready, turn it down to 350 and pour 1 cup room temperature water into the pan. Place you bread pan on center rack above roaster. These are all methods learned from my great grandmother. If you are going to make much bread, invest in a cloth bread sheet which you flour and keep in the fridge. You will never go back to the counter or slippery plastic sheets. Also but a good metal bread pan. Mine has a cutting board for the lid but keeps bread perfectly with no wrappers or muss.

I like this recipe because it follows the principles of traditional breadmaking: proof the yeast and then add the other ingredients. Other bread machine recipes said to add the yeast last. I ended up with loaves as dense as a brick. My first two batches rose VERY close to the top of my bread machine so I've had to back off on the yeast just a smidge. I went from 1 1/2 t to 1 1/4 t. I used a high quality olive oil for my oil, fresh bread machine yeast, and King Arthurs bread flour. This recipe works consistently in my 1990s Oster bread machine. It produces a tall loaf with a crisp/flaky crust. The center is fluffy and cake like. No holes. I find it nice for toast or big sandwiches.
Fantastic reciepe one of the best I've tried so far.. I'm new to using a bread machine I will definitely make again.
Extremely easy to follow and tastes great! Couldn‚Äôt get anything more simple!

I just got a bread maker from my mom that was manufactured in 2014. I tried making just dough and then baking in the oven and also letting it go the full cycle in the machine, but the bread was coming out really tough and under-baked. I thought it might be the maker so I was cautiously optimistic about this recipe, and the bread came out PERFECT! I now am excited to make more bread adding flavors. Thanks for this recipe!!
Good basic taste, might add a touch more sugar and salt but we thought the crust was excellent
What a great recipe. This size was perfect for my bread machine.
Fantastic!!! Used olive oil because that was all I had on hand and upped the salt as other reviewer suggested.

My husband makes this bread literally EVERY DAY. He found this recipe by simply Googling. It was the first recipe that came up. It's PERFECT. You don't need to change a thing. It's so economical too! Sometimes he adds Rosemary. He's experimenting this week with flax too. We love it. Go for it !!!

Thank you for sharing this recipe. It is very simple. My bread machine is new, so I'm having a few issues adjusting to the settings. Your bread recipe tastes amazing! Again, thank you so much for the recipe. It is the easiest and most delicious I have tried! I'll keep tweaking the settings on my machine. Each loaf looks better than the last.
Love it and used peanut oil because that is all I had besides canola. I‚Äôd like to know what oil everyone uses because one reviewer said not to use canola oil
OMG‚Ä¶..best bread ever from my machine! Two bites already gone in photo. Flavourful, soft and not as dense as the recipe in bread machine manual. Will be making again!!
FINALLY!!! I‚Äôve found a recipe that looks, feels, and tastes like bread for my bread machine! If you follow the directions and pre-prep your yeast action, you won‚Äôt be disappointed.
The first time I made this recipe, I was not impressed. However, I changed the water to milk and sifted the flour for the second time. It turned out much better.

'Baking is my nemesis, I‚Äôm really bad at it. I figured I‚Äôd try a bread machine, nearly a complete fail. Even though I followed directions to a t. It tasted great but didn‚Äôt rise much. Yeast was fine and bloomed well. Loaf was 5‚Äù in length and dense. Recipe 5stars, my ability-5.
I didn‚Äôt make any changed and it turned out fine. My husband prefers this one over most of the others I make. Makes really good toast.

This is the best bread machine recipe I've ever made! I read the comments, I increased the salt to 1 1/2 tsp., and I used the dough setting. I let it rise in a bread pan until doubled, then baked at 395 degrees for about 22 minutes until center was 190 degrees. This is a keeper!

This was a great recipe! I used it for my first bake in my first bread maker. It was so simple! I added the yeast to the liquid just like you stated and everything went just fine. I might add a bit of honey next time to give a slight sweeter flavor just for fun. Also, I used regular all purpose flour as that's all I had. Thank you!
No flavor.
Really good tasty bread. I never leave a recipe alone and never make it the same way twice. I added an egg and minced garlic. And the second time made the dough into pretzel bites. Tasty!

Best bread I have ever made in my machine. I will not go back to the way my machine's book tells you to make bread. My family loved the bread. I am adapting the recipe to make raisin bread hoping it turns out as good as the white loaf I made!
5 outa 5

Oh my goodness! Was this tasty!!! I was so worried that this would not work in my Zojirushi bread machine as it was completely contrary to the order of ingredients. This recipe is the best I have tried so far and will now be my go too recipe! I made it just as written. Thank you so much for sharing your recipe!

For those who are reluctant to spend the money on a bread machine there is a solution to your dilemma. I bought my bread machine at a Goodwill store as a used appliance for $35. I could not tell it had ever been used. It has a view window in the top which is nice. This recipe worked marvelously first time out. I used it because there is no Krusteze bread machine flour available anywhere in our area anymore. Thank you pandemic. I bought bread flour which is also in short supply. The only change I made was to chip up some cold butter (salted) and drop it into the mix. These days of shortages, I think my bread machine will more than pay for itself.
I am new to bread machines, and this recipe goes against the instructions it came with. However the bread turned out perfect.
Easy to make and delicious to eat

Good, important to use bread flour for light, chewy texture. If you don't like your bread to taste sweet, I would reduce to 1.5 tablespoons of sugar. I had no problems with the dough over proofing so if you generally don't have that issue I would leave salt at 1 teaspoon, I ate the bread with salted butter so I don't want it too salty. Tried the recipe twice with success, definitely try with less sugar if you usually eat European style bread

This is a great recipe; however, I took another viewer‚Äôs recommendation to increase the salt by 1/2 tsp. so the loaf wouldn‚Äôt collapse of which it didn‚Äôt‚Ä¶.thank you! However, I then gave a slice to a veteran 62 year-bread-maker-from-scratch for comments. She thought it was good but suggested I swap out the vegetable oil for lard (melt and then cool) for better flavor. It sure made a difference! Try it and see for yourself!
Best bread recipe!

I used Stevia instead Of sugar and I used I can't believe it's not butter lite instead of oil and butter and it still came out pretty good. I usually use extra virgin olive oil and Trivia brand stevia sweetener and it almost taste identical... Still very good

Back story is that I bought a bread machine for my son and he/we had lost results over and over so we stopped using the machine. I saw this recipe and thought since it was the oppo tysite of the bread machine directions I'd try it! So glad I did! Unfortunately, I'm scared to try recipes that are designed to separate the yeast from the liquids.
